intro: Paracaryum paphlagonicum, commonly known as the Paphlagonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
